project.teaser: Critical infrastructures for, e.g. the transport of goods and people or the supply of energy and water, are the lifelines of our globalized society. Impairments can result in enduring supply bottlenecks, significant disruptions to public safety or other dramatic...
project.objective: Critical infrastructures for, e.g. the transport of goods and people or the supply of energy and water, are the lifelines of our globalized society. Impairments can result in enduring supply bottlenecks, significant disruptions to public safety or other dramatic consequences. Currently used monitoring processes for these infrastructures are costly, difficult to implement in isolated areas, nonuniform due to heterogenous technical solutions and poorly scalable or automatable. The project Instantaneous Infrastructure Monitoring by Earth Observation (IIMEO) contributes to an end-to-end solution for the operational real-time, high-resolution monitoring of critical infrastructure by means of an innovative observation payload for a future LEO constellation. Our system concept focusses on data availability within less than 1 hour from user request to information delivery by AI-based processing approaches implemented on space-qualified on-board hardware. To provide a persistent weather-independent monitoring service with an improved spatial resolution of up to 50 cm, we propose a novel sensor configuration consisting of a 35-GHz-SAR sensor in combination with optical cameras. Based on existing technology from scientific institutions and European space industry, hard- and software will be further developed up to TRL 6. Development will be carried out in close cooperation with a railway company as a pilot user to define use cases for commercial applications based on the requirements of industry and public services. The end-to-end prototype service including on-board processing will be demonstrated within a final flight campaign. A roadmap will describe the further exploitation of the project results and outline further applications of the technology to other infrastructure systems. A follow-up demonstrator mission in 2026/27 is envisaged to showcase the monitoring of railways from space on a global scale on TRL 7.
project.title: Instantaneous Infrastructure Monitoring by Earth Observation
project.keywords: Instantaneous Earth Observation, Infrastructure Monitoring, On-Board Autonomy, Persistent Observation, End-to-End EO Systems

result.title: Dissemination and Use Plan (M18)
result.description: M18 Report providing a further detailed planning of the dissemination and exploitation activities the partners plan to undertake including further refinements of the dissemination goals and channels, target groups, business models and exploitation approach for project results, along with detailed individual plans for exploitation for each partner.

result.title: Dissemination and Use Plan (M6)
result.description: M6 Report with first planning of dissemination and exploitation activities the partners plan to undertake including dissemination goals and channels, target groups, and exploitation approach per project result. It also contains initial considerations of the long-term circular business.

result.title: Roadmap to space and for future Earth-observation services (M18)
result.description: Presents a first version of the Roadmap addressing the future pathway for Earth-observation services.

result.title: IIMEO System Concept
result.description: Public version of the deliverable D12 presenting an overview on IIMEO Concept

result.title: State-of-the-art Update, Requirements and Use Cases Specifications
result.description: Definition of the pilot use cases and end user requirements on the IIMEO solution, including resulting requirements regarding on-board processing, the constellation and data transfer requirements and an update of the state-of-the-art and specify technical requirements.

result.title: Project Website, Presentation and Brochure
result.description: A public website describing initially the project objectives approach partners involved and expected results Later updates will include announcements of workshopsconferences downloadable paperarticles and public project deliverables The presentation and brochure will present the project to interested parties including details on the technical challenges and approaches being developed to address the challenges the expected impact from both a technical and societal standpoint and where to obtain further information and details

result.title: Specification of On- and off-board algorithm
result.description: Public document, covering the specification of the on-/off-board algorithms, taking the specific requirements of infrastructure monitoring into account.

result.title: Data Management plan (M6)
result.description: Development of the Data Management Plan that details, what types of data generated by the project will be open, according to “Guidelines on Data Management in Horizon Europe” at M6 and update at M36.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - IIMEO (Instantaneous Infrastructure Monitoring by Earth Observation)
result.teaser: Critical infrastructures, e.g. transport, energy and water, are essential to our society. Disruptions can lead to supply bottlenecks, impairments to public safety or other dramatic consequences and should thus be recognised and fixed as soon as possible. Accordingly, critical...

category.title: optical sensors

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
